div.l: But I Am old me list nat to pley for Age
Gras tyme is done my fodiryfodiyfodir is forage
This white topp̄e writith my old ȝeris
But yf I fare as done þese opyn̄ eris
My hert also mowlith as myne hers
That ilk fruyte is evir lengir the wers
Til it be rotyn̄ in mullok or in stre
Wee old men I drede so fare wee
Til wee be rotyn̄ can̄ wee nat be ripe
Whe hopyn̄ al wey while þat þe world wold pipe
For in our͗e wil ther͗e stikkith evir͗e a nayle
To have an hore hede and agrene taile
As hath a leke for thogh our͗e myght be goon̄
Our͗e wil desirith fully evir in one
For when wee may nat do þan wol we spekyn̄
Ȝit in our͗e asshen̄ old fier͗e is rekyn̄
Four͗e gledis have wee wich I shal devise
Awᵃaunnting / lying · Angir / and couetise
These four͗e sparkelis longith vn to held
Our͗e old lymmys mowe wee nat weld
But wil shal nat faile that is soth
And ȝit have wee al wey a coltis toth
As many aȝeer͗e as it is passyn̄ hen̄
Syn̄ that my tap of lyfe be gan to ren̄
For sikirly when̄ I was born̄ anon̄
Deth drewe the tap of lyfe and lete it gon̄
And evir sith hath so the Tap I ronn
That almost empty is the Tonne
The streme of lyfe nowe droppith on þe Chimbe
The sely tong may wele speke and ring
Of wrecchidnes that passid is ful ȝore
With old folk save dotage ther͗e is no more
When that our͗e hoost had herd þis sermonyng
He gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
And seid what Amountith al this wit
What shul wee speke al day of holy writ
